snippet.textDisplay: Wouldn't the amount of mass in the new universe be limited to the amount of mass the black hole consumed in its life time? snippet.textDisplay: Thank you for your videos. I've had a similar theory of my own - Our universe lives inside a 4D universe's blackhole. 3D universes (ours) have 2D blackholes with 2D universes. 2D with 1D. snippet.textDisplay: The anthropic principle doesn't make sense, not beyond its weakest form, because we don't know whether there are exotic forms of intelligence that we wouldn't recognize even if we touched them. We are bound to be anthropocentric in these kinds of speculations, so we shouldn't take them too seriously. Lee Smolin's argument is fascinating because it explains why the universe is likely to allow our form of life to exist. It doesn't implicitly assume that our  form of intelligence  is the only possible in any kind of possible universe.  Field fluctuations in a chunk of space of a universe without mass, might be wondering why they exist.
snippet.textOriginal: The anthropic principle doesn't make sense, not beyond its weakest form, because we don't know whether there are exotic forms of intelligence that we wouldn't recognize even if we touched them. We are bound to be anthropocentric in these kinds of speculations, so we shouldn't take them too seriously. Lee Smolin's argument is fascinating because it explains why the universe is likely to allow our form of life to exist. It doesn't implicitly assume that our  form of intelligence  is the only possible in any kind of possible universe.  Field fluctuations in a chunk of space of a universe without mass, might be wondering why they exist.

snippet.textDisplay:
If Cosmic evolution is true, then life is only here as a mechanism to better help its adaption.
We should be blowing more shit up, because 'saving the Earth or universe' will halt its evolutionary growth.
Life was introduced to throw a needed spanner in the works to speed things up, once this is accomplished then the bacteria of life can be eliminated from the natural Cosmic cycle. We could start by blowing up Pluto thus stopping all the debates on this useless planet.

Future beings: Imagine life in the past wanted to SAVE the planet, and the reality was we needed to fuk it up.
And only then will the Cosmic evolutionary cycle continue. Hmm, I bet intelligent robots will work this out too.
Thus reeking havoc everywhere and finally eliminating the awkward then unneeded process of the waste of life.

Such a positive outcome for our Cosmic evolution. Life originated to benefit its survival. We better start doing shit. When life is happy and content it wants to keep the status quo, but make most of life in pain and suffering most of the time, then they won't just make change they'll want to make change! Thus this must be our reason to exist.
